conclusion: Analyze energy and momentum changes to determine velocity ratio.
Initial potential energy before collision is U_i = mgh.
Final potential energy after collision is U_f = mgH.
Work done by air resistance during descent is W_descent = -λmg(H - h).
Work done by air resistance during ascent is W_ascent = -λmg(H - h).
Total work done by air resistance is W_total = -2λmg(H - h).
Total mechanical energy lost is ΔE = mg((3λ - 1)h - (2λ - 1)H).
Kinetic energy before collision is K_i = 1/2 mv_0^2.
Kinetic energy after collision is K_f = 1/2 mv_f^2.
Energy loss equation is mg((3λ - 1)h - (2λ - 1)H) = 1/2 (v_0^2 - v_f^2).
Ratio of post-collision to pre-collision velocity is v_f/v_0 = sqrt(1 - 2g((3λ - 1)h - (2λ - 1)H)/v_0^2).
Given constraints, the velocity ratio simplifies to 1/2.
